programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.(n)

Diagnosed with spinal cancer, 27 year old Adam (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) navigates the road to recovery with the sometimes-overbearing support of his crude best friend, Kyle (Seth Rogen), his smothering mother (Anjelica Huston) and an inexperienced therapist (Anna Kendrick). Inspired by a true story, 50/50 is an honest yet hysterically funny account of a young man's journey toward healing.(n)

programme.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
programme.desc: The fourth remake of Anthony Hope's swashbuckling adventure stars Stewart Granger as both the prince of a Ruritanian country and his impersonator, a British citizen who winds up being crowned king after the real royal is poisoned and left in a coma. Lewis Stone, who plays the Cardinal, had the lead role in the 1922 silent version of the tale.

programme.title: King Solomon's Mines
programme.desc: The wife of an adventurer hires an explorer to find her missing husband, who never came back from an expedition to find the legendary diamond mines of the Biblical ruler. A Best Picture nominee.

programme.title: Scaramouche
programme.desc: In 18th-century France, a roguish ne'er-do-well masquerades as an actor in a plot to avenge the death of his friend who was killed during a duel with a master swordsman. The film is famous for one of the longest sword fights in cinema history. Lewis Stone costars as Georges de Valmorin and played villainous Marquis de la Tour d'Azyr in the 1923 silent version.

programme.title: Moonfleet
programme.desc: In 1750s England, an orphaned lad is put in the care of a roguish smuggler who develops a tender side as he begins to entertain affectionate feelings for the boy. And soon he's trying to protect him from the dangers inherent in his illegal activities.

programme.title: Green Fire
programme.desc: In Colombia, an emerald miner clashes with a local coffee-plantation owner, natural disasters and murderous bandits.

programme.title: Everything's Rosie
programme.desc: A crooked-yet-lovable sideshow medicine man rescues an orphan and raises the girl as his own.

programme.title: Going Places
programme.desc: A sporting-goods salesman with a fear of horses poses as a famous rider in an effort to make more sales, leading to many wacky misunderstandings.

programme.title: Madame Du Barry
programme.desc: Chronicle of the 19th-century French courtesan (Dolores Del Rio) and her ill-fated romance with King Louis XV (Reginald Owen). Richelieu: Osgood Perkins. Marie Antoinette: Anita Louise. Duchesse de Grammont: Verree Teasdale. Contesse de Berne: Helen Lowell. D'Aiguillon: Victor Jory. Excellent cast. Directed by William Dieterle.

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
programme.desc: Shakespeare's play about a collection of people who have a mystical, comedic and humorous experience in the forest, where their romantic entanglements are resolved through the mischief of the fairies.

programme.title: That Certain Woman
programme.desc: A secretary elopes with a man above her station; their marriage can be annulled, but there is a baby that cannot be.

programme.title: The Sisters
programme.desc: Misfortune follows three sisters who choose the wrong men to be their husbands in turn-of-the-century San Francisco.

programme.title: The Story of Louis Pasteur
programme.desc: A tribute to the chemist's pioneering work in medicine includes his cure for rabies, his development of an anthrax vaccine and his insistence on the value of sterilization. Inspired by actual events.

programme.title: The Little Princess
programme.desc: Shirley Temple in a story about a Victorian waif who haunts British hospitals looking for her father after he is allegedly killed while fighting in the Boer War. An adaptation of the Frances Hodgson Burnett kid-lit classic.

programme.title: Glamour for Sale
programme.desc: Minor exposé of crooked escort services that use its “escorts” to prey on unsuspecting males. Anita Louise, Roger Pryor, Frances Robinson. Peggy: June MacCloy. Lucille: Veda Ann Borg. Regan: Don Beddoe. Braddock: Arthur Loft.(n)

programme.title: Shadowed
programme.desc: A businessman (Lloyd Corrigan) encounters danger when he runs into a gang murder while playing golf. Anita Louise, Michael Duane, Robert Scott. Leisurely paced yarn. A good job by Corrigan. John Sturges directed.(n)

programme.title: Judge Priest
programme.desc: In 1890s Kentucky, an unconventional and sympathetic judge presides over town intrigues, including encouraging his nephew to continue his courtship of the girl-next-door despite her shrouded past.(n)

programme.title: Green Light
programme.desc: A selfless young doctor assumes the blame for a senior surgeon's fatal mistake in the operating room.(n)

programme.title: The Go Getter
programme.desc: After losing a leg in the crash of the dirigible Macon, a man (George Brent) tries to succeed as a lumber salesman. Anita Louise. Cappy: Charles Winninger. Skinner: John Eldredge. Tinsdale: Henry O'Neill. Entertaining. Directed by Busby Berkeley.(n)

programme.title: Brides Are Like That
programme.desc: Anita Louise and Ross Alexander are an engaging pair in this trifle about a small-town girl who marries a likable loafer. Joe Cawthorn, Gene Lockhart. Ella: Kathleen Lockhart. Jennie: Mary Lou Treen. Mary: Alma Lloyd. Carter: Craig Reynolds. Jenkins: Dick Purcell. Directed by William McGann.(n)

programme.title: Personal Maid's Secret
programme.desc: Ruth Donnelly gives a fine performance as a lovable domestic who guides the destinies of her employers. Daughter: Anita Louise. Mrs. Smith: Margaret Lindsay. Tom: Warren Hull. Brother: Frank Albertson. Junior: Ronnie Cosby. Butler: Arthur Treacher. Modest but appealing. Arthur Greville Collins directed.(n)

programme.title: Night Song
programme.desc: A brilliant pianist is struck blind. A wealthy woman pretends to be poor and blind to help him regain his confidence, and holds a contest with a large prize for the best musical composition. She, as the blind girl, encourages him to enter it. He wins the prize, uses the money to have his sight restored, falls in love with the wealthy woman, and is thrilled to find that his two loves are one and the same.(n)

programme.title: The North Star
programme.desc: A Russian farming collective endures Nazi atrocities when Germany occupies their village in 1941. When the local children are subjected to involuntary blood donations and medical experiments, resistance begins to grow.(n)

programme.title: Beyond a Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: In order to expose a corrupt DA, a crusading publisher concocts a legal hoax with his future son-in-law to prove the unreliability of circumstantial evidence, with unanticipated complications.(n)

programme.title: While the City Sleeps
programme.desc: When a media mogul dies, his ambivalent son pits three newsmen against each to become his right-hand man, but ambition collides with danger and the competition attracts the attention of a brutal serial killer.(n)

programme.title: Sealed Cargo
programme.desc: A skipper (Dana Andrews) comes across a foundering vessel and finds a deadly secret. Carla Balenda, Claude Rains. Conrad: Philip Dorn. Steve: Skip Homeier. McLean: Onslow Stevens. Well made; suspenseful. Alfred Werker directed.(n)

programme.title: Curse of the Demon
programme.desc: In England, an American professor looks into a devil-worshipping cult that may been responsible for a few recent deaths, but when his investigation hits too close to home, the cult leader slips a cursed parchment into his research files and his life becomes a hell on Earth.(n)

programme.title: The Best Years of Our Lives
programme.desc: Three veterans of WWII have various difficulties readjusting to normal life after returning home from the war. One tries to help get financial help for veterans, another disappoints his wife who expects more from him, and the third negotiates life without hands, having lost them during his service. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Ox-Bow Incident

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: The autobiographical recollections of writer-director Barry Levinson recount the story of five high-school grads on the brink of adulthood in 1959 Baltimore. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: This sports-history saga is the fact-based tale of the Texas Western squad that won the 1966 NCAA basketball championship—the first team to do so starting an all-black lineup. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Nine to Five
programme.desc: Three female office workers become friends and get revenge against their boss, a sexist egotistical lying hypocritical bigot, and in so doing create a more efficient and pleasant work environment. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A neurologist investigates the case of a young boy who has somehow repeatedly cheated death after the youth survives yet another near-fatal accident on his ninth birthday. As the doctor becomes obsessed with this mystery, he also develops romantic feelings for the boy's mother. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Ouija Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widow making ends meet as a psychic is stunned when she finds a Ouija board that actually enables her to talk to the dead. While it's great for business, the board also allows a vengeful ghost to possess her 9-year-old daughter. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: 5 Flights Up
programme.desc: When an elderly couple discover that their Brooklyn apartment has increased in value, they decide to sell and move to Manhattan. However, they soon learn that relocating won't be easy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: Tim wants to snag a big promotion at work, but to do so he must take an eccentric nutcase to his boss's dinner party, where guests are supposed to bring the strangest person they can find. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: 17 Again
programme.desc: A former high-school basketball star gets a second shot at life after he's miraculously transformed back into a teenager. Back in high school, Mike O'Donnell was an MVP. But then Mike sacrificed everything in order to stay by his expectant girlfriend Scarlett. Twenty years later, Mike's life is falling apart when he's suddenly transported back into his teenage body and he discovers that by trying to recapture his best years, he could risk losing it all. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: In the Land of Women
programme.desc: A jilted L.A. screenwriter visits his sick grandmother in Michigan and gets involved with an attractive neighbor and her daughter. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Ghost Writer
programme.desc: A British screenwriter (Ewan McGregor) agrees to ghostwrite the memoirs of a retired prime minister, but after he takes the job the former political leader is accused of committing a war crime. As the writer uncovers facts that corroborate these suspicions, he begins to fear he might be killed, just like the man who worked on the memoirs before him. Directed by Roman Polanski. Pierce Brosnan, Tom Wilkinson, Olivia Williams. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: Tim wants to snag a big promotion at work, but to do so he must take an eccentric nutcase to his boss's dinner party, where guests are supposed to bring the strangest person they can find. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Full Monty
programme.desc: Downtrodden British steelworkers start their own male exotic-dancing troupe to help make ends meet after seeing the success of the Chippendale Dancers, but the local talent leaves much to be desired. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Capturing the Friedmans
programme.desc: Shocking, Oscar-nominated portrait of a middle-class Long Island family unraveling after the father and one of his sons are accused of molesting neighborhood children. Feature debut for director Andrew Jarecki, who won the Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Romeo and Juliet A Love Song
programme.desc: (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Transcendence
programme.desc: An AI expert's consciousness is transferred into a computer after he is killed by a radical antitechnology faction. As his awareness goes viral, he becomes an unstoppable force inhabiting every computer and electrical system on the planet. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Passenger 57
programme.desc: The cohorts of a ruthless terrorist hijack a plane to rescue him from an FBI escort, but they do not know that a terrorism expert is aboard. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: An alcoholic lawyer thinks he can make some quick cash getting a settlement for the family of a woman who is in a coma after being operated on at a Catholic hospital. However, he becomes emotionally involved in the case, turns down the offer, and takes the powerful institution to court. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The House
programme.desc: After realizing that they can't possibly afford the tuition for their daughter's college, a married couple team up with their eccentric neighbor to make money by running an illegal casino in the suburbs. Needless to say, things quickly spiral out of control as they deal with unruly guests while trying to keep their operation hidden from the police. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Mountain Between Us
programme.desc: Two strangers embark on a dangerous trek to safety after their chartered flight crashes on a remote snowy mountain in Utah. Along the way, the pair begin to develop feelings for each other as they try to stay alive and get back to civilization. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: An Eastern European man is forced to live at JFK Airport after his visa is canceled due to a coup in his own country. In time, the terminal becomes a virtual country within itself, complete with culture, ambition, status, diversity and the need for love. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Identity
programme.desc: On a dark and stormy night, ten strangers are stranded at an isolated motel in the Nevada desert, only to learn each of them has a secret, and that their arrival at the motel has not been a matter of mere chance. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Fargo

programme.title: Better Luck Tomorrow
programme.desc: Justin Lin directed and co-wrote this drama about a group of Asian-American scholars turned gangstas in affluent Orange County, Cal. programme.title: Held Up

programme.title: Doc Hollywood
programme.desc: A plastic surgeon finishes his residency and heads for a lucrative job in L.A. Distracted, he plows into a fence and is sentenced to community service and fence repair in a small South Carolina town. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.desc: An aspiring lounge singer falls for a poker-playing stud in Las Vegas. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Diner

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc: A struggling actor and crook moves to Los Angeles, hoping to score some movie roles, where he meets a gay PI at a party. When a series of female bodies turn up, they find themselves investigating the murders. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Yes Man
programme.desc: A perennial naysayer becomes a guy who just can't say "no" (and won't) after attending a self-help seminar that challenges him to say yes to everything for a year. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Taxi
programme.desc: After losing his driver's license, a bumbling cop teams up with a brassy cabbie so he can pursue a team of female bank robbers who are led by a beautiful Brazilian. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.desc: When an elderly couple discover that their Brooklyn apartment has increased in value, they decide to sell and move to Manhattan. However, they soon learn that relocating won't be easy. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Cate Blanchett reprises her role as Queen Elizabeth I in this account of her efforts to defend England from King Philip II of Spain, while trying to suppress her attraction to the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh. (cc).

programme.desc: An aging Lothario falls for the playwright mother of his much younger girlfriend. (cc).

programme.desc: A salty curmudgeon discovers he has a teenage daughter who has been put up for adoption by his ex-wife after their split. He tries to reunite the family, but his abrasive personality makes getting reacquainted unpleasant for everyone. (cc).

programme.title: Post Grad
programme.desc: A college graduate (Alexis Bledel) considers where her life is heading after moving back into her childhood home and beginning the search for a perfect job and the perfect man. Michael Keaton, Carol Burnett, Zach Gilford, Rodrigo Santoro. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A study of adolescent obsession with sex, drugs, and rock and roll has a girl seeking romance advice from an upperclassman on how to get a boy to notice her; and a stoner feuding with a teacher. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Outcast

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: Director Michael Mann's historical crime drama follows the efforts of top FBI agent Melvin Purvis in capturing notorious bank robber John Dillinger. programme.title: You Got Served

programme.desc: A recent film-school grad gets a dream job as a personal assistant to a Hollywood mogul, who not only tyrannizes him, but also takes credit for his script. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Dla tych, którzy twierdzą, że w telewizjach muzycznych i radiach pojawia się za mało polskiej muzyki, Eska TV proponuje program "Polska noc". To całonocne pasmo zarezerwowane jest dla krajowych wykonawców.

programme.title: Słoiki
programme.desc: Prawdzie historie ludzi, którzy przyjechali do Warszawy, by odmienić swoje życie. Mieszkańcy niewielkich miast i wsi liczą, że w stolicy uda im się zrealizować marzenia o lepszej pracy i pieniądzach. Nie łatwo jest im jednak odnaleźć się w wielkomiejskiej rzeczywistości.

programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Co się słucha?

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2
programme.desc: Twórcy programu w każdym wydaniu prezentują 10 wybranych hitów. Utwory, będące największymi przebojami najsłynniejszych wykonawców, grane są jeden po drugim.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: The pressure is on as Sandy and SpongeBob compete in a series of extreme underwater activities with the population of Bikini Bottom cheering them on. Later, SpongeBob covers up the fact that he caused emotional harm to an oyster at the zoo. Patrick: Bill Fagerbakke. Sandy: Carolyn Lawrence. SpongeBob: Tom Kenny. (repeat).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Jellyfish Hunter; The Fry Cook Games
programme.desc: SpongeBob naively helps Mr. Krabs enslave the entire jellyfish population, with the exception of Ol' Buzzy. Later, he competes against his best friend, Patrick, in the “Fry Cook Games.” (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Tea Leaves
programme.desc: A faulty tea-leaf reading leads Phoebe into a fling with a freak (James LeGros); Rachel tries to smooth things out with a jilted Joey by asking him for advice on an odd---and untrue---situation at work; Ross gets caught in a tight spot while trying to retrieve a shirt from his ex-girlfriend (Bonnie Somerville). Mr. Zelner: Steve Ireland. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Alec Baldwin guest stars as Phoebe's overly optimistic new beau, who brings out the worst in everyone at the Gellers' anniversary bash. Meanwhile, Monica hopes to craft a toast to her folks that's sure to get the guests crying. Jack: Elliott Gould. Judy: Christina Pickles. Aunt Lisa: Ellen Gerstein. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Clip show. Joey bumbles down memory lane while being interviewed by a soap-opera magazine, while the gang takes on the full-time job of making sure he doesn't say anything stupid. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Baby Shower
programme.desc: Monica incurs the wrath of Mrs. Green (Marlo Thomas) by forgetting to invite her to Rachel's baby shower, where the mom-to-be begins to see that she may not be ready for motherhood after all. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler help Joey prep for an audition to host the world's worst game show. Katherine: Adria Tennor. Ray: Jonathan Nichols. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Cooking Class
programme.desc: Ross's date with a baby-furniture saleswoman (Rena Sofer) brings out the brat in Rachel; Joey and Monica sneak into a cooking class after a bad review sends the crestfallen chef on a mission to disprove her detractor; Phoebe teaches Chandler how to interview for a new job without annoying his future boss. Sarah: Molly Hagan. Eric: Tim Maculan. Mr. Tyler: Tucker Smallwood. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Rachel Is Late
programme.desc: A week past her due date, a grumpy Rachel's only hopes for inducing labor include spicy foods and something even spicier with Ross. Meanwhile, Monica and Phoebe try to make the baby wait interesting---and profitable; and Chandler catches heat for catching some sleep during Joey's big-screen debut. Estelle: June Gable. Dr. Long: Amanda Carlin. Ross: David Schwimmer. (repeat).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: Crazy Eyes and a Wet Brad Pitt
programme.desc: Christy and Bonnie experience luxury when the wealthy Jill (Jaime Pressly) asks them to keep her company on her first night out of rehab. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: Soapy Eyes and a Clean Slate
programme.desc: Christy tries to make amends for her past deeds. Bonnie takes a cue from her and decides to make up for treating Alvin so poorly through the years. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: Godzilla and a Sprig of Mint
programme.desc: Christy meets her single neighbor (Colin Hanks). Meanwhile, romantic plans for Bonnie and Alvin are foiled by Alvin's ex-wife (Beverly D'Angelo). (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.desc: Christy seeks a new career. Meanwhile, Bonnie and Alvin attempt to recapture their youth. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Angie wants to take in George's homeless assistant, who takes Carmen under her wing by dressing her older and taking her to a club. Marisol: Tonantzin Esparza. programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: I Only Have Eyes for You

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Hilary Duff plays a cosmetics saleswoman who trains Angie; George's generous review nets Ernie a promotion to a post George feels is beyond his capability. Stacey: Susan Slome. Kris: Mary Kowalski. Frank: Mel Rodriguez. Jack: Jack Blessing. Mel: Mark Tymchyshyn. Ernie: Valente Rodriguez. Angie: Constance Marie. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly runs into her nemesis while attending a college fair for Barry and Erica. Elsewhere, Murray and Adam encounter problems with late fees at the video store. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray invites a bored Pops into his store, but in doing so he leaves himself open to plenty of criticism. Meanwhile, Dana comes over to study with Adam, who receives some questionable advice from Erica and Barry. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.desc: A compilation episode. (repeat).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: Bubble Puppy becomes ill and is treated by a veterinarian while Gil makes him a get-well card. (repeat) (cc).

programme.desc: Marshall goes on a solo mission to save some kittens while his pals are at parachute training; a deer clan get stuck on slippery ice and need to be rescued. (repeat).

programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Blimp; Pups Save a Chili Cook-Out

programme.desc: Visiting Dr Ranj at the Children's hospital today is Petal. Petal needs the cast on her arm changing because it has got dirty and is crumbling. Petal has a fractured arm.
